title: 45+ Cool Fonts for Creating Refreshing Designs
description: If you're on the lookout for all of the best cool fonts, then this feature is for you! Check out our roundup of all the best picks in the category here!
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: If you're on the lookout for all of the best cool fonts, then this feature is for you! Check out our roundup of cool fonts & elevate your designs.
text: If you’re on the lookout for all of the best cool fonts, then we’ve got you covered! Are you looking for some cool fonts to take your designs to the next level? In this article, we have compiled a selection of the 45 best cool fonts ready to make your design projects stand out. These cool fonts suit just about any project you can think of. Whether you are searching for a cool font for branding, posters, fashion, advertising, invitations, or any other design, you should find it here. Now, let’s dive into our list of the 20 best cool fonts. UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Cool Fonts. image credit: Envato Elements Download all the Cool Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need! 1. Cool Unicorn Cool Unicorn. image credit: Envato Elements What better way to start this list than with a font pack that’s aptly called Cool Unicorn? It’s a fun, bold display font that comes with a fresh and modern style. It features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and more. As such, we can guarantee that this fun aesthetic is more than suitable for logos, branding, greeting cards, posters, and other crazy designs you can think of! 2. Hastings – Cool Handletter Font Hastings – Cool Handletter Font. image credit: Envato Elements Another one of our bigger favorites is Hastings. It’s a cool hand-letter font suitable for fashion, branding, catalog, and other designs. This font is equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and multilingual support. It also includes loads of ligatures, stylistic alternates, and more. This font comes with four spacing options— normal, condensed, monospace, and expanded. 3. The Belonid – Cool Serif Fonts The Belonid – Cool Serif Fonts. image credit: Envato Elements Introducing The Belonid, a cool serif font with visual elegance and smooth curves to make your work look true and attractive. This font contains uppercase & lowercase characters, numerals, punctuations, beautiful ligatures, alternates, and multilingual support. It comes with normal spacing and can be optimized to any size. This versatile font works great in both large and small sizes. It is suitable for a wide variety of projects, such as invitations, logos, branding, mugs, magazines, photography, cards, product packaging, quotes, posters, labels, signatures, and more. Overall, we like that this font is perfect for all business projects, as well, including personal projects, studios, corporates, and creative agencies! 4. Attomi Gilbert – Cool Handwritten Font Attomi Gilbert – Cool Handwritten Font. image credit: Envato Elements Here’s an elegant script font with a passionate handmade feel to each character, making it a perfect choice for vintage or urban projects. What we like about Attomi Gilbert is that it’s an organic handwriting gesture from an excellent brush that is useful for multipurpose projects. Like many of its contemporaries, it comes equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, ligatures, swashes, alternates, and multilingual support. 5. CoolKids Bold CoolKids Bold. image credit: Creative Market Inspired by the song “Signs of Life” by Arcade Fire, CoolKids is a playful and bold semi-connecting script font perfect for creating logos, packaging, posters, etc. The font features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and multilingual support. Additionally, we like that this font includes initial and final alternates to make your designs feel more natural and similar to handwriting. Each character in this font is carefully drawn, and connections are very smooth, making it suitable for various design needs. 6. Karl – Cool Sans w Unique Alternates Karl – Cool Sans w Unique Alternates. image credit: Creative Market Here’s a bespoke & minimalist sans-serif typeface that is great for designing unique logos & brands, bold packaging, powerful website headers, and more. This font contains 26 stylistic alternates to make everything you design look refined, unique, and professional—a feature that we always try to look out for! The thoughtfully & somewhat irregularly designed alternates, in combination with the clean main characters in this font, create a perfect balance for your design project. You can also use the Karl font for bold branding, unique cover designs, stylistic headings, clean packaging, meaningful quotes, etc. 7. Polka Collecta – Bold Playful Polka Collecta – Bold Playful. image credit: Creative Market Polka Collecta is a playful display font with alternate cuts perfect for display needs such as quotes, branding, logos, posters, cover designs, and more. This bold & fun sans-serif typeface comes in two styles — regular and playful. We love that the playful version of this font is best suited for creating unique compositions because of the informal grid. Moreover, the stylistic alternate characters give the composition a unique personality. 8. Classy Vogue – Stylish Serif Classy Vogue – Stylish Serif. image credit: Creative Market Create the best designs with this stylish display serif, suitable for a wide range of design needs. Known as Classy Vogue, this font features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, alternates, ligatures, and multilingual support. The elegant and luxurious style of this font can perfectly match any of your branding projects and other design needs! We can’t wait to use this ourselves! 9. Talissa A Handmade Font Talissa A Handmade Font. Image credit: Creative Market Here’s a handmade font we’re sure will look great for branding, websites, printings, T-shirts, logos, magazines, designs, headlines, banners, posters, promotional products, print ads, and more. “The Talissa – A Handmade font” has a wonderful design with a unique, detailed, and handmade look. It looks great in all caps with a wide-set spacing if you want to try a classy look or beautiful on its own in uppercase and lowercase letters for something completely timeless. 10. Ovation – Cool Calligraphy Font Ovation – Cool Calligraphy Font. image credit: Envato Elements Elevate your designs with this cool calligraphy font that has a distinctive character and is elegant to use. Ovation is a relaxed and flowing handwritten font that fits a wide range of design needs. It contains uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, ligatures, and multilingual support. This font comes with four spacing options, too — normal, condensed, monospace, and expanded; and can be optimized to any size. Add this font to your favorite creative ideas and see how they come alive. 11. Cool Sensation – Graffiti Font Cool Sensation – Graffiti Font. image credit: Envato Elements This is a freestyle font with street art characteristics that shows freedom and is filled with unique characters. Overall, we like that Cool Sensation font features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, ligatures, alternates, and multilingual support, making it a flexible pick. Furthermore, it comes with four spacing options and can be optimized to any size. 12. Cool Kid – Fun | Children | Display Font Cool Kid – Fun Children Display Font. image credit: Envato Elements Get inspired the way we were by the unique feel of this fun display font that is a perfect fit for any children’s project designs. Cool Kid is created with a fun style and has a unique style that will add a friendly feel to your upcoming projects. It features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, stylistic alternates, and multilingual support. The font comes with normal spacing and can be optimized to a large (display/poster) size. You can use this font for posters, brand logos, product packaging, and more. To access the alternate glyphs in this font, you need a program that supports OpenType features such as Adobe Illustrator CS, Photoshop CC, or InDesign. 13. Zero Mistake – Cool Blackletter Display Font Zero Mistake – Cool Blackletter Display Font Inspired by gothic and horror style, Zero Mistake is a cool blackletter display font suitable for logotypes, posters, badges, book covers, t-shirt designs, packaging, etc. Because of its unique shape, we like that this font is perfect for any project that will need a gothic or horror-style theme. It comes equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, symbols, extra dingbat, and multilingual support. 14. District – Cool Script Font District – Cool Script Font. image credit: Envato Elements Create the best designs you can think of with this cool script font! Loaded with a chunky aesthetic that’s both cute and elegant, we like that District is an incredibly versatile, relaxed, and flowing handwritten font. It contains uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, symbols, ligatures, and multilingual support. This font fits a wide pool of designs and elevates them to the highest level. You can use this font for your favorite creative ideas and see how it makes them come alive. 15. Marzone – Cool Cartoon Display LA Marzone – Cool Cartoon Display LA. image credit: Envato Elements Here’s a cartoon display font that will make your designs look unique and fun. This font is easy to install and features standard characters and multilingual support. It comes with normal spacing and can be optimized to any size. The Marzone font is great for labels, quotes, posters, DIY projects, branding, packaging, photography overlays, signs, greeting cards, websites, photos, window art, scrapbooking, tags, and so on. Marzone is accessible in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Adobe InDesign, and it even works on Microsoft Word. 16. School Blots – Cool Font School Blots – Cool Font. image credit: Design Cuts Presenting School Blots, a funny school kid’s font that can be used in a wide range of design needs. This font comes in two styles— black regular and black outline. You can use these styles individually or easily combine them to make your designs unique. Each font features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, and punctuation. As a result, we recommend that you use this set for notebooks, diaries, posters, social media posts, and children’s graphics in typography. 17. Mongek Typeface Mongek Typeface. image credit: Design Cuts Designed with a modern concept that is simple and dynamic, Mongek is an easy-to-use font that can be applied to any design, especially those with an elegant and smooth concept. The serif style adopted by this font is a 2022 style font. It features uppercase & lowercase characters, numerals, punctuations, unique swash alternatives, and a large selection of ligatures. What impresses us the most is that this pack also contains 603 glyphs with many unique and interesting alternative options. In addition, there’s a cool serif font family for header and description text from thin to heavy. This font is accessible in both design and non-design programs because everything and glyphs are supported by Unicode (PUA). 18. Plasticine Typography Creator Plasticine Typography Creator. image credit: Design Cuts Meet Plasticine, a clay and Play-Doh style lettering and graphic toolkit that is perfect for social media, flyers, posters, banners, marketing campaigns, packaging, phone cases, logos, greeting cards, branding, quotes, t-shirts, websites, blogs, and so much more. This font comes packed with a great set of 3D style letterings, fonts & elements for your new artistic projects. You’ll also find eight lettering sets & 7 color fonts, a lot of graphic elements, seven regular fonts, backgrounds, and eight scenes in this set of fonts. Moreover, all these cool letterings, fonts, and graphics are ready for print or online use. You must drag and drop the different elements in this font to create custom scenes and compositions. 19. Grow Bones Family Stencil Font Grow Bones Family Stencil Font. image credit: Design Cuts The Grow Bones Family Stencil font is designed with a serif font concept and has a sporty display stencil style. The irregular dynamic shapes but impressively regular and unique shapes of this font make it different to grab your audience’s attention. This font is equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, alternates, and ligatures. It contains 571 glyphs—a feature we really like—with many unique and exciting alternative options. In addition, this font also includes a cool serif font family for header and description text from thin to heavy to thin. Overall, this font is very easy to apply to any design, especially those with sporty, modern, and strong concepts. 20. Powerful Font Trio Powerful Font Trio. image credit: Design Cuts Created by hand (and mouse), this is an ultra-cool font trio suitable for a wide range of designs. It includes three fonts: shadow, filled, and inline. You can use these font styles individually or combine them to make your designs stand out. The Powerful Font Trio features standard characters, numerals, punctuations, and more. 21. Nilota Typeface Nilota Typeface. Image credit: Design Cuts Bloom your designs with this elegantly themed font with a dynamic serif style. The details of the shape are very smooth and flow to create unique and beautiful curves. This font is very easy to apply to any design, especially those with an elegant and smooth concept. It comes equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, alternates, ligatures, and more. The Nilota Typeface font contains 618 glyphs with many unique and exciting alternative options. Moreover, there’s a cool serif font family for header and description text from thin to heavy, making it suitable for a wide range of designs. This font is very easy to use both in design and non-design programs because everything and glyphs are supported by Unicode (PUA). 22. Mono and Friends Mono and Friends. image credit: Design Cuts Meet Mono and Friends, a cool font package for design projects that are non-formal, funny, cute, and so on. This font is inspired by monoline-style fonts. It consists of 6 unique and cool family packs. They come equipped with uppercase & lowercase characters, numerals, punctuations, alternates, and more. 23. Queenlery Sans Serif Queenlery Sans Serif. Image credit: Design Cuts Fall in love with this elegant, wavy, and delicate sans-serif font. Queenlery sans-serif font features a classy look, making it an ideal choice for logos, branding, posters, advertising, promotions, invitations, stationery, wedding designs, social media posts, etc. It contains uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and multilingual support. This font is easily accessible in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and CorelDraw, and it even works on Microsoft Word. Have fun with this cool font and explore its endless variations. 24. Maglony Typeface Maglony Typeface. image credit: Design Cuts Say hello to one our personal favorites: Maglony typeface, an elegantly themed font with a dynamic serif style. The details of the shape of the Maglony Serif Elegant typeface are very smooth and flow to create unique and beautiful curves. This elegant typeface is very easy to apply to any design, especially those with a sleek and smooth concept. It contains 577 glyphs with many unique and exciting alternative options. Additionally, there’s a cool serif font family for header and description text from thin to heavy, making this font suitable for a variety of designs. 25. Honya Typeface Honya Typeface. image credit: Design Cuts This font is inspired by the classic era typeface of the 1800 era but is combined with today’s era and produces a very elegant and charming typeface. The details of this font shape are very subtle and flow, creating unique and gorgeous curves. This font is very easy to use in design and non-design programs because all alternates and glyphs are supported by Unicode (PUA). Honya Typeface contains 797 glyphs with many unique and exciting alternate swash options. Plus, this font also includes alternate cool serif fonts for header text and description. 26. Cool Unkle A handwritten display font. image credit: Envato Elements Make your work stunning with this handwritten display font to give an extra creative look to your content. This font has bold strokes and upper and lowercase characters with few ligatures, making it a good option for designing logos, social media posts, books, movie titles, cover pages, etc. Cool Unkle font is also compatible with short and long alphabets of sans or serif font types. This typeface supports more than 100 languages available in OTF and TTF formats. 27. Dope Script Astounding font with great looks. image credit: Envato Elements This cool hand-brushed font has raw and rough edges, which are appropriate for designing your logos, posters, merchandise, and other display text. The range of features of the Dope Script font includes lowercase letters, numerals, punctuation, capitals, and accents. Please check out the characters with a few bonus swashes to use with your text. 28. Sigmatone An elegant font for your designs. image credit: Envato Elements It is inspired by old-school graffiti tags and street art. This font has been carefully vectorized to make your projects enticing. It adds value to the appearances of movie titles, book titles, social media posts, logo designs, and short and long text letters. Sigmatone is also suitable for secondary text font with either sans or serif. The features of this font include standard upper- and lowercase letters, numerals, punctuation, alternates, and ligatures. This PUA-encoded font also has multilingual support in different languages. You need to use Adobe software and Corel Draw because they support this amazing font’s glyphs panel and OpenType features. 29. Bettawork Bettawork. image credit: Envato Elements Now, we are introducing Bettawork, a bold-styled brush script font designed in a casual and vector format. This organic brush script has letters written with brushes, which makes it a charming, authentic, yet realistic font. This typeface is capable of bringing a natural look to the text. You can make your designs more interesting using its two styles through ligatures. Bettawork is great for branding projects, logotypes, quotations, product packaging, home décor, and more. The features of this font include standard glyphs, alternate glyphs, ligatures, PUA-encoded OTF, TTF, and web font formats. It is easy to install and works on both PC and Mac. This multilingual typeface is fully accessible through Adobe (Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign) and Microsoft Word without requiring additional design software. 30. Candela Candela. image credit: Envato Elements The stylish handcrafted font, Candela, is all set for logos, branding, social media posts, advertisements, quotes, signage, product packaging, product designs, labels, photography, watermark, fashion design, boutique items, etc. This font has a soft impression, perfect for beauty-themed products and stylish text, which becomes prominent with an appropriate background image. The main characteristics of this font include uppercase and lowercase letters, numerals, punctuation, and easy installation. This font can be used on both Mac and Windows OS, and you’ll get it in OTF, TTF, WOFF, and WOFF2 file formats. 31. Mattolla Mattolla. Image credit: Envato Elements Mattolla natural hand-drawn bush font has an irregular baseline, suitable for title designs, such as headlines, films, quotes, branding designs, logotypes, etc. The features of this brush-textured font include multiple file formats (OTF, TTF, and WOFF), ligatures, basic Latin language support, and PUA-encoded characters that are fully accessible without additional design software. 32. Northrow Northrow. image credit: Envato Elements Northrow fits for home décor projects, branding, product packaging, and stylish text that covers a simple background. This classy signage-styled font has 94 stunning ligatures to maximize the hand-lettered design. Other features include standard dual-case letters, numerals, punctuation, and 13 swashes. You can get this font in OTF, TTF, and WOFF file formats. 33. Fatin Gengky Fatin Gengky. Image credit: Envato Elements It is inspired by classic typography, which brings unique styles to any project design. This serif font can be the best for headlines of all sizes and block text. Be it a web design, printout, moveable image, or any other digital project, Fatin Gengky will give it a spectacular look. The features of this cool font include upper and lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, easy installation, different file versions (OTF, TTF, and WOFF), and usefulness in PC and Mac environments. This multilingual font is available in two styles: Regular and italic. This typeface is accessible through Adobe software and even Microsoft Word. 34. Spanish Spanish. image credit: Envato Elements This modern signature-style font is high on the list of recommended fonts to design your projects with its natural signature look. The features of this Spanish script font include ligatures and swashes you need to use. When you type text, the natural handwritten or signature-styled text will appear on the screen to alleviate the overall outlook of your design project. 35. Panbers Font Panbers. image credit: Envato Elements The bold script font, Panbers, comes with extras. You’ll like this font style because it has a beautiful, slightly shaky, and handwritten text style. The standard ligatures of this font create a more natural look by adding double letters to the text. The multilingual support and accent characters are useful for international projects. It is great for branding projects, home décor, product packaging, and stylish text in project designs. Panbers font is available in both OTF and TTF file formats. They are accessible through Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or any software that can use a glyphs panel. 36. Stigfier Stigfier. image credit: Envato Elements The stylish and contemporary serif font, Stigfier, is ideal for presenting small titles, subtitles, and text descriptions. You can use it to create fascinating advertisements, social media campaigns, and other cool promotional content. The features of this font include all caps, punctuation, numeric, ligatures, support on Windows OS and Mac, and bio space that bring out a stunning outlook of letters. The multilingual support of this elegant serif font in both upper and lowercase letters produces a neat texture with fine lines added to the characters, giving it a fresh aesthetic look. This modern font is available in OTF, TTF, WOFF, and WOFF2. 37. The Balletta The Balletta. image credit: Envato Elements Up next, The Balletta script is a quick, informal, and authentic brush font. The letters are drawn with a brush to give a handcrafted look. You need to activate the ligature and OpenType panel to use this lovely font. The characteristics of this font give a real, natural vibe to the text. It perfectly goes with artwork, branding, logo design, quotations, and product packaging. The features of the script typeface include standard glyphs, ligatures, multilingual support, simple installation, usability in both PC and Mac, and availability in OTF and TTF formats. This font is accessible through Adobe software and Microsoft Word. This PUA-encoded font does not need any additional design software. 38. Bee Think Beethink. image credit: Envato Elements Bee Think is a rough brush typeface for quick and casual tasks. The font is available in two styles: Standard and italic, which are available in a vector format. To create a design using these styles, you need to enable the ligatures. Bee Think is a good option for projects like home décor, home accessory ideas, branding, logos, quotations, product packaging, and more. The characteristics of this font include standard characters, web font, OTF and TTF file formats, alternates, and easy installation. This font works equally well on PCs and Macs without requiring additional design software. It is accessible through Adobe software (Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign) and Microsoft Word. This PUA-encoded font has multilingual support in several languages. 39. Konde Konde. Image credit: Envato Elements The Konde typeface has a distinctive and stylish shape, created using a retro-style concept. In addition to the excellent option for text, Konde is also appropriate for book covers and projects with a retro-elegant theme. From thin to black, there are three sub-fonts in this font family. Because of its PUA-encoding, this font is very easy to use with glyphs in both design and non-design software. This font has 549 glyphs with various alternate options. It is a good choice for creating headers and descriptions. This typeface is available in OTF, TTF, WOFF2 (thin-black), and PDF file versions. You must install Adobe software (Illustrator CS, Photoshop CC, and InDesign) and Corel Draw to use its beautiful swashes. You can install additional swash files if your software does not support the glyph panel. 40. Afire Love Afire Love. image credit: Envato Elements For a calm, lovely, and sophisticated appearance, the Afire Love font is hand-drawn from scratch. Additionally, this endearing font has the elegance of abstract typography for a wide range of project designs, such as digital natural handwriting texture for designs like promotional text, posters, signatures, quotes, social media posts, business designs, advertisements, banners for restaurants, and other designs of your choice. The characteristics of this font include standard glyphs, ligatures, easy installation, and multilingual support. This display font functions on both PC and Mac. It is accessible in Adobe software and Microsoft Word and can be downloaded in OTF, TTF, and WOFF files. 41. Hi Dudes Hi Dudes. image credit: Envato Elements Presenting Hi Dudes, a new addition to the Envato family. This beautiful brush display font with a natural text style has a distinctive look and a dynamic environment. This font gives your text a more attractive, genuine appearance. You can use the 24 ligatures and glyphs of the OpenType panel to use this typeface to its fullest. It’s a great choice for projects such as printed quotes, logo designs, invitation cards, product packaging, headlines, letterhead, posters, and watermarks on photography. It is perfect for logos, branding, advertisements, product packaging designs, stationery, wedding invites, labels, and other special events that require a handcrafted vibe. The features of this versatile font include standard glyphs, ligature glyphs, PUA encoding, multilingual support, and multiple formats, such as OTF, TTF, and web font formats. This font can be used in Microsoft Word and Adobe design software without additional design software, and it works equally well on PC and Mac. 42. Imogen Agnes Imogen Agnes. image credi: Envato Elements Imogen Agnes is a handcrafted font with a trademark look that can be used to quickly and simply produce unique, fashionable text. It is excellent for creating custom logos and works well as a retro-inspired solo script font. This font offers upper and lowercase letters, numerals, punctuation, and multilingual support. It also provides a bonus set of 15 swashes to give your text some extra elegance. The stylistic alternates of this typeface work for lowercase characters. This font’s glyphs panel unlocks in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop. 43. Moon Walk Moon Walk. image credit: MyFonts Designed by EI Mehdi, Moon Walk is an elegant yet unique font with a bold style, perfect for brand design and logotypes. This detailed and assertive sans serif font contains shaped alternates to produce various creative designs with a distinctive touch. 44. Loyola Round Loyola. image credit: Design Cuts This super funky multilingual font family with 11 fonts is perfect for short texts, book titles, clothing, and logotypes. The stylistic alternates of this font require professional software like Adobe and Inkscape. 45. Habel Handmade Duo Habel. Image credit: Creative Market Lastly, the handmade brush script font features dual case letters, numerals, punctuation, and alternates. This beautiful font is ideal for quotations, branding, logos, merchandise, social media posts, headlines, invites, wedding cards, book titles, packaging material, etc. The features include a regular font, OTF, TTF, and web font formats, non-English characters with bonus features of 40 floral doodle vector clipart designs, and a handmade business card. Our Favorite Cool Fonts Still undecided? Check out our favorite cool fonts below! Cool Unicorn Cool Kid - Fun Children Display Font Hastings - Cool Handletter Font The Belonid - Cool Serif Fonts CoolKids Bold Karl – Cool Sans w Unique Alternates Cool Sensation - Graffiti Font District - Cool Script Font Powerful Font Trio Ovation - Cool Calligraphy Font Polka Collecta - Bold Playful Marzone - Cool Cartoon Display LA Best Punk Fonts Best T-Shirt Fonts Best Modern Fonts Best Western Fonts Best Asian Fonts Best Trendy Fonts Fonts to Draw Best Headline Fonts Best Canva Fonts Best Fun Fonts Cool Fonts to Draw Best Urban Fonts Best Fonts for Graphic Designers 38 of My Favourite Fonts for Design 30+ Timeless Fonts Best DaFont Fonts Cool Fonts Summary So, there you have it—our list of the 45 best cool fonts can take your designs to new heights. If you’re feeling inspired, go ahead and use one or more of these fonts in your next project.
html:
If you’re on the lookout for all of the best cool fonts, then we’ve got you covered!

Are you looking for some cool fonts to take your designs to the next level? In this article, we have compiled a selection of the 45 best cool fonts ready to make your design projects stand out.

These cool fonts suit just about any project you can think of. Whether you are searching for a cool font for branding, posters, fashion, advertising, invitations, or any other design, you should find it here. Now, let’s dive into our list of the 20 best cool fonts.

UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the Cool Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need!

1. Cool Unicorn

What better way to start this list than with a font pack that’s aptly called Cool Unicorn? It’s a fun, bold display font that comes with a fresh and modern style. It features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and more.

As such, we can guarantee that this fun aesthetic is more than suitable for logos, branding, greeting cards, posters, and other crazy designs you can think of!

2. Hastings – Cool Handletter Font

Another one of our bigger favorites is Hastings. It’s a cool hand-letter font suitable for fashion, branding, catalog, and other designs. This font is equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and multilingual support. It also includes loads of ligatures, stylistic alternates, and more.

This font comes with four spacing options— normal, condensed, monospace, and expanded.

3. The Belonid – Cool Serif Fonts

Introducing The Belonid, a cool serif font with visual elegance and smooth curves to make your work look true and attractive. This font contains uppercase & lowercase characters, numerals, punctuations, beautiful ligatures, alternates, and multilingual support. It comes with normal spacing and can be optimized to any size.

This versatile font works great in both large and small sizes. It is suitable for a wide variety of projects, such as invitations, logos, branding, mugs, magazines, photography, cards, product packaging, quotes, posters, labels, signatures, and more. Overall, we like that this font is perfect for all business projects, as well, including personal projects, studios, corporates, and creative agencies!

4. Attomi Gilbert – Cool Handwritten Font

Here’s an elegant script font with a passionate handmade feel to each character, making it a perfect choice for vintage or urban projects. What we like about Attomi Gilbert is that it’s an organic handwriting gesture from an excellent brush that is useful for multipurpose projects.

Like many of its contemporaries, it comes equipped with uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, ligatures, swashes, alternates, and multilingual support.

5. CoolKids Bold

Inspired by the song “Signs of Life” by Arcade Fire, CoolKids is a playful and bold semi-connecting script font perfect for creating logos, packaging, posters, etc. The font features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and multilingual support.

Additionally, we like that this font includes initial and final alternates to make your designs feel more natural and similar to handwriting. Each character in this font is carefully drawn, and connections are very smooth, making it suitable for various design needs.

6. Karl – Cool Sans w Unique Alternates

Here’s a bespoke & minimalist sans-serif typeface that is great for designing unique logos & brands, bold packaging, powerful website headers, and more. This font contains 26 stylistic alternates to make everything you design look refined, unique, and professional—a feature that we always try to look out for!

The thoughtfully & somewhat irregularly designed alternates, in combination with the clean main characters in this font, create a perfect balance for your design project. You can also use the Karl font for bold branding, unique cover designs, stylistic headings, clean packaging, meaningful quotes, etc.

7. Polka Collecta – Bold Playful

Polka Collecta is a playful display font with alternate cuts perfect for display needs such as quotes, branding, logos, posters, cover designs, and more. This bold & fun sans-serif typeface comes in two styles — regular and playful.

We love that the playful version of this font is best suited for creating unique compositions because of the informal grid. Moreover, the stylistic alternate characters give the composition a unique personality.

8. Classy Vogue – Stylish Serif

Create the best designs with this stylish display serif, suitable for a wide range of design needs. Known as Classy Vogue, this font features uppercase & lowercase letters, numerals, punctuations, alternates, ligatures, and multilingual support.

The elegant and luxurious style of this font can perfectly match any of your branding projects and other design needs! We can’t wait to use this ourselves!

9. Talissa A Handmade Font
